pros: Supportive, friendly, and professional leadership.  Everyone has an opportunity to grow and advance.
cons: Low pay. Salary does not reflect  job requirements and performance.

review_title: counselor aide contractor for the army side
pros: Great work helping active duty service members and their families. Great coworkers. My manager was awesome.
cons: One of my Education Service Specialists did not know what she was doing. Made the job harder than it should have been. Totally underpaid position, especially since our ESS made me do the stuff she was supposed to.

pros: I like that when you are the lead site coordinator, you can decide how you want to run your site. You attend events, build classes, open and close classes, attend marketing events, and so much more.
cons: The pay can sometimes make it where you do more work than what you're getting paid to do. You definitely have to have a passion for what you do.

review_title: Big Pay Disparity in the Management Staff in Europe
pros: The people are great to work with. Time off is plentiful.
cons: Anyone on the Europe staff with the "new" title Director or Assistant Director, the base salary is the same. There are other CTC employees in Europe who have been with the company for a longer period of time with the title of Assistant Director or Supervisor that make significantly more than those employees with the title of Director.

review_title: Pay didn’t line up with job expectations
pros: It was great working with the students and seeing them succeed.
cons: The amount of work that is expected of you with the pay that is given is appalling.

pros: It's decent experience you get a lot of training
